Description: Fragment of neck and shoulder of East Greek pottery closed vase, oenochoe or amphora; ridge at shoulder turn. Inside reserved; outside, between bands, guilloche.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 12 no. 36 pl. 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.919)
